newsitem.title: USA: Cargill's Excel says Illinois pork plant back up.
newsitem.headline: Cargill's Excel says Illinois pork plant back up.

text.p: Operations resumed early Friday at Cargill Inc's Excel Corp pork plant in Beardstown, Ill. after a brief closure this week because of a water pipe valve malfunction, a company spokesperson said.
"We started up at 0950 CDT and will have a regular second shift and run two shifts on Saturday," said Mark Klein, Excel spokesman.
The plant had been shut since the end of the first shift Wednesday when the water valve malfunctioned causing concern the fresh water supply had been compromised, Klein said.
About 16,000 hogs per day are processed at the plant.
